django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck
===========================================

.. py:module:: django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck

.. autoapi-nested-parse::

   This module houses the error-checking routines used by the GDAL
   ctypes prototypes.



Functions
---------

.. autoapisummary::

   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.arg_byref
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.ptr_byref
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_const_string
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_string
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_envelope
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_geom
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_geom_offset
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_srs
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_arg_errcode
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_errcode
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_pointer
   django.contrib.gis.gdal.prototypes.errcheck.check_str_arg


Module Contents
---------------

.. py:function:: arg_byref(args, offset=-1)

   Return the pointer argument's by-reference value.


.. py:function:: ptr_byref(args, offset=-1)

   Return the pointer argument passed in by-reference.


.. py:function:: check_const_string(result, func, cargs, offset=None, cpl=False)

   Similar functionality to `check_string`, but does not free the pointer.


.. py:function:: check_string(result, func, cargs, offset=-1, str_result=False)

   Check the string output returned from the given function, and free
   the string pointer allocated by OGR.  The `str_result` keyword
   may be used when the result is the string pointer, otherwise
   the OGR error code is assumed.  The `offset` keyword may be used
   to extract the string pointer passed in by-reference at the given
   slice offset in the function arguments.


.. py:function:: check_envelope(result, func, cargs, offset=-1)

   Check a function that returns an OGR Envelope by reference.


.. py:function:: check_geom(result, func, cargs)

   Check a function that returns a geometry.


.. py:function:: check_geom_offset(result, func, cargs, offset=-1)

   Check the geometry at the given offset in the C parameter list.


.. py:function:: check_srs(result, func, cargs)

.. py:function:: check_arg_errcode(result, func, cargs, cpl=False)

   The error code is returned in the last argument, by reference.
   Check its value with `check_err` before returning the result.


.. py:function:: check_errcode(result, func, cargs, cpl=False)

   Check the error code returned (c_int).


.. py:function:: check_pointer(result, func, cargs)

   Make sure the result pointer is valid.


.. py:function:: check_str_arg(result, func, cargs)

   This is for the OSRGet[Angular|Linear]Units functions, which
   require that the returned string pointer not be freed.  This
   returns both the double and string values.
